text: Joseph Paul Franklin (April 13, 1950 - November 20, 2013) was an American serial killer. He tried to kill Larry Flynt, a magazine publisher, in 1978 and Vernon Jordan, Jr., the civil rights activist, in 1980. He has been given six life sentences. He lived at Potosi Correctional Center on death row. On November 20, 2013 he was executed at 8:30am with Propofol, a lethal drug, for killing a Jewish man outside a synagogue. He was diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia. Franklin said that he thought he deserved to die for his crimes. Larry Flynt wrote in an essay published in the Hollywood Reporter, “I do not want to see him die.” Franklin was executed on November 20, 2013 by lethal injection. ==References== Category:1950 births Category:2013 deaths Category:Executed American serial killers Category:People executed by lethal injection Category:People from Mobile, Alabama Category:People with schizophrenia
title: Joseph Paul Franklin
